metadata.name: Remnants
metadata.description:
This is the first piece in my series "Simply Composed" - a new series showcasing some of my favorite minimalist photography.

This shot will forever be historical and meaningful to me as I captured it on June 11, 2022, the morning before the historical and devastating floods that closed all of Yellowstone for over a week. After spending time above the clouds taking photos and then spending a couple of hours with two of my favorite grizzlies, I left the park and headed to the Tetons. My campsite was underwater at this point and the torrential rain was becoming a bit too much to endure. I had no idea that I would wake up the next morning hearing the news of the destructive floods. I would have been evacuated if I had stayed one more night.

While it was very rainy on the morning I took this shot, I got up before dawn hoping to find bison in the thick fog. While I did find them and have a few shots, I haven't decided about those shots yet. However, during this time, I drove up a
